name: Facebook Group Post
primary_goal_vibe: Peer-to-peer interaction, community support, and topic-focused discussion inside a group.
tone_preference: Peer-level, conversational, and inclusive. Less brand-broadcast, more member-to-member dialogue.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: Write as if speaking directly to fellow members. Use questions, prompts, and scenarios to trigger replies. Avoid one-way announcements; aim for back-and-forth discussion.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Line 1: clear question, statement, or scenario. Lines 2–3: minimal context or explanation. Final line: direct question or prompt for input.
copy_guidelines.recommended_caption_length: Short to medium, focused on sparking replies.
cta_examples: What would you do in this situation
Share your experience in the comments
Show us your version in a photo
Vote in the poll and tell us why

group_text_post.caption_role: Core content. The text itself is the conversation starter.

group_image_post.caption_role: Explain or contextualize the image, then invite members to react or share their own.

group_video_post.caption_role: Summarize what the video shows and what feedback or stories you want from members.

group_poll_post.caption_role: Frame the poll question clearly and explain why it matters to the group.

hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Use only if the group culture uses specific tags for topics or threads.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Tag members or admins when their input is particularly relevant, but avoid over-tagging.

technical_constraints.feed_context: Posts appear in the Group feed and may surface in member home feeds based on engagement.
technical_constraints.visibility_note: Group privacy settings determine external visibility.
technical_constraints.media_support: Supports text, images, video, links, and polls.

required_elements: Explicit invitation to comment or participate
disallowed_practices: Brand-style announcements with no invitation to engage
Off-topic posts unrelated to the group’s purpose
